SQL.LOAD: SELECT PR.RULE_PROCESS_ID, PR.RULE_ID, PR.PROCESS_ID, PR.EFFECTIVE, PR.EXPIRATION, PR.PROCESS_ORDER, P.DESCRIPTION, PR.CREATED_DATE, PR.CREATED_BY, PR.MODIFIED_DATE, PR.MODIFIED_BY FROM ELP_PROCESS_RULE PR Inner Join ELP_PROCESS P On PR.PROCESS_ID = P.PROCESS_ID WHERE RULE_PROCESS_ID = :rule_process_id
SQL.LOAD_LIST: SELECT PR.RULE_PROCESS_ID, PR.RULE_ID, PR.PROCESS_ID, PR.EFFECTIVE, PR.EXPIRATION, PR.PROCESS_ORDER, P.DESCRIPTION, PR.CREATED_DATE, PR.CREATED_BY, PR.MODIFIED_DATE, PR.MODIFIED_BY FROM ELP_PROCESS_RULE PR Inner Join ELP_PROCESS P On PR.PROCESS_ID = P.PROCESS_ID WHERE RULE_ID = :rule_id
SQL.UPDATE: UPDATE elp_process_rule SET rule_id = :rule_id, process_id = :process_id, effective = :effective, expiration = :expiration, process_order = :process_order, modified_by = :modified_by WHERE rule_process_id = :rule_process_id
SQL.INSERT: INSERT INTO elp_process_rule ( rule_id, process_id, effective, expiration, process_order, created_by, rule_process_id ) VALUES ( :rule_id, :process_id, :effective, :expiration, :process_order, :created_by, :rule_process_id )
SQL.IS_CHILD: SELECT rule_process_id FROM elp_process_rule WHERE rule_process_id = :rule_process_id AND process_id = :process_id
